title: Pope Francis's death: What is the protocol for the next few days?
summary: There is no room for improvisation when it comes to the pontiff's funeral and succession. The organization of the Apostolic See's vacancy is orchestrated by the cardinals, who will come from all over the world and meet in Rome until one of them is elected pope.

title: Pope asked for simple, unadorned tomb as the 'sunset' to his 'earthly life' approached
summary: In his will, Francis, who died on Easter Monday at age 88, specified the exact spot for his tomb at Santa Maria Maggiore, even including an attached diagram for clarity: 'The tomb must be in the earth; simple, without particular decoration and with the only inscription: Franciscus,' it read.

title: Pope Francis has died
summary: Elected to the See of Peter in March 2013, Argentina's Jorge Mario Bergoglio was the first South American pope. Considered a bold reformer by some, lax in defending tradition by others, he had to deal with clergical sexual abuse scandals. He died on Monday, April 21, at the age of 88, the Vatican said.

title: Why Pope Francis's legacy on pedophilia in the Church feels incomplete
summary: From the US to Australia via Germany, France, Portugal, Belgium, Argentina, Mexico and Colombia: Never had a pope been confronted with so many Church sexual scandals as Francis. While he did respond with an unprecedentedly firm stance for a pontiff, the reforms he proposed were not met with unanimous approval.

title: After Pope Francis' death, Catholics gather in prayer worldwide
summary: From Jakarta to Buenos Aires, via Paris and New Delhi, a global tour in images capturing the final tributes paid to Pope Francis on the day his death was announced.

title: World reactions to death of Pope Francis
summary: The Argentinian leader of the Catholic Church died on April 21 at age 88. European leaders as well as those in the US and Middle East expressed their condolences.

title: Russia resumes attacks on Ukraine after Easter truce
summary: Vladimir Putin announced on Monday that 'military action has resumed' with aerial attacks on Ukraine. Each side had accused the other of thousands of violations of the ceasefire, which Putin ordered on Saturday. The declaration had come after Trump said he would end US efforts to halt the war unless the two sides moved towards an accord.

title: Sudan’s paramilitaries kill more than 30 in a new attack on a Darfur city
summary: International aid agencies have long warned that a full-scale RSF assault on El-Fasher could lead to devastating urban warfare and a new wave of mass displacement. UNICEF has described the situation as 'hell on earth' for at least 825,000 children trapped in and around El-Fasher.

title: Haiti near 'point of no return' as gang violence spirals, UN envoy warns
summary: Before the UN Security Council, Maria Isabel Salvador called for urgent international intervention to prevent a humanitarian and security disaster.

title: Delta Air Lines plane catches fire at Orlando airport
summary: The engine fire broke out late Monday morning while the plane was at the ramp before a scheduled departure from Orlando to Atlanta, airport officials said. The passengers were evacuated.

title: Why the fight against drug trafficking in post-Assad Syria matters
summary: Saudi Arabia, the world's leading consumer of captagon, is backing the new Syrian regime's campaign to eradicate the production of this amphetamine at its source, highlights historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: Kenya's Korir and Lokedi win Boston Marathon
summary: Sharon Lokedi broke the marathon course record and fellow Kenyan John Korir joined his brother as a race champion on Monday as the city celebrated the 250th anniversary of the start of the Revolutionary War.

title: Photographer Aurore Bagarry's subtle shades of Atlantic gray
summary: The artist is exhibiting her Atlantic coast landscapes at the GwinZegal Art Center in Guingamp, Brittany – images that tell the paradoxical tale of the construction and destruction caused by the sea.

title: War in Ukraine: Russia's timely 'Easter truce'
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Russia's truce was, above all, aimed at showing the Trump administration its desire to continue peace talks. Though the truce was violated several times, it also led to a major prisoner exchange.

title: World Expo symbolizes of Osaka's revival
summary: After decades of relative decline, the capital of Japan's Kansai region is launching major projects and attracting numerous visitors.

title: 'They are literally living in hell': In Israel, the hostage issue is a slow poison within society
summary: In a wounded nation, the stories of liberated hostages reignite wounds and anger, even hatred, day by day. This helps to explain why no real debate has emerged on the proportionality of Israel's response in Gaza.

title: How Grindr shapes young gay men's sexualities: From idealized bodies to violence
summary: An entire generation of young queer men have explored their sexuality on Grindr, the gay dating app that recently turned 15. Today, many of them are questioning the influence the platform and its macho norms had on their emotional development.

title: Five Paris bagel shops to fill the hole in your stomach
summary: Whether opting for the classic smoked salmon filling or risking a Mediterranean twist, Le Monde has compiled a selection of coffee shops, bakeries and restaurants to enjoy the round, doughy speciality from the Big Apple.

title: Kyoto between nature, culture and traditions, and far from clichés
summary: The former imperial capital is both the symbol of Japan's temples and geishas and of globalized overtourism. And yet, blocks away from the crowds and Instagram spots, designers, chefs and gallery owners are opening experimental restaurants, sharing the art of lacquerware and rescuing architectural nuggets from oblivion.

title: Death of Pope Francis: Rome's farewell between the faithful's grief and Vatican protocol
summary: Following the announcement of Pope Francis's death on Monday morning, April 21, the bells of Saint Peter's Basilica tolled and the Vatican's yellow and white flags were lowered to half-mast, following a perfectly codified ceremonial. Later, masses were celebrated throughout Rome, culminating in the first public prayer at Saint Peter's Square at 7:30 pm, attended by thousands of faithful.

title: In Austria, the president of Parliament becomes a major embarrassment
summary: Since his election in October 2024 as the head of the National Council, Walter Rosenkranz, a senior member of the far-right FPÖ party, has made a series of blunders and provocations, openly displaying his Nazi affinities.

title: Emmanuel Macron vows to step up reconstruction in cyclone-hit Mayotte
summary: The French president announced on Monday a three-billion-euro package over six years to finance a plan to 'rebuild' France's poorest department. Four months after the disaster, Macron visited the Indian Ocean archipelago to 'take stock of what is being done well, what is not being done well enough'.

title: Pregnancy denial, a frequent but mysterious disorder
summary: One in 500 women learns late that she is pregnant. One in 2,500 realizes it when giving birth. This psychological pregnancy disorder, the mechanisms of which remain difficult to understand, can affect all women, even those who are already mothers.

title: JD Vance meets Indian PM Modi for trade talks
summary: The US vice president's office reported 'significant progress' in the talks and said the two men had established a roadmap for how economic discussions would proceed.

title: Five charts to understand how China can retort to Trump's trade war
summary: Donald Trump has reignited his trade war against China. But Beijing has several tools at its disposal to defend itself, including its control the yuan, domination of the rare earths market, and the US Treasury bonds it holds.

title: Economist Antoine Bouët: 'Among high-income countries, the US will suffer the most from Trump's trade war'
summary: Donald Trump's tariff hikes are not driven by commercial rationality, but purely by electoral motives, writes economist Antoine Bouët in an op-ed for Le Monde. The US is likely to bear the brunt, primarily to the detriment of low-income earners and the middle class.

summary: The director of the Washington-based Center for Climate & Security said militaries needed to be prepared as the world experiences an increasing number of extreme weather events caused by climate change.

title: Death of Pope Francis: In Jerusalem, the memory of a pope committed to the Palestinians
summary: The situation in Gaza never ceased to torment Pope Francis, who recognized the State of Palestine as early as 2015. On Sunday, he condemned the 'dramatic and disgraceful humanitarian situation' in Gaza while warning against the 'growing climate of anti-Semitism.'

summary: The president of the United States once again targeted the Federal Reserve, the American central bank. The result was investor panic, causing a stock market drop, an interest rate hike and a dollar downturn.

summary: The worsening of climate change aligns with long-standing scientific predictions, yet climate-skeptical discourse and opinions persist, illustrating the ability of narratives to create alternative realities, writes Le Monde's Stéphane Foucart in his column.
